original: Berggren, Gilbert Claes Josef, läroverksadjunkt, Skövde, f. 8/4/00 i Sandhem, Skarab. 1., av godsäg. Albin B. o. Jenny Andersson. G. 31 m. Greta Gustafsson. Barn: Rigmor f. 32, Gil’bert 41. — Stud:ex. i Skara 22, fil. kand. i Upps. 25, fil. mag. 27, teol. kand. 31, pro vår i Upps. 36. Lär. i Falköp. 28, Mariestad 29, vik. adj. i Borås 31-32, extralär. i Höganäs 32- 35, vik. adj. i Borås 36, extralär., e. adj. i Upps. 37-38, adj. i krktend rkiin-sk. o. modersm. v. Lysekils samrealsk. 37, dito v. Skövde h. allm. lärov. 46. Förordn. s. bibi. v. samrealsk. i Lysekil 38-46, vik. rektor somrarna 38-45. Led. av lokalstyr. v. samrealsk. 42-46, styr. f. Lysekils högerfören. 43-46, styr. f. Lysekiilisavd. av Sv. familjevärnet o. Lysekils turistfören. Resor t. Danm. 33 o. 34, Norge 39. Skr.: artiklar o. recensioner i tidn. o. tidskr.
translated: Berggren, Gilbert Claes Josef, high school teacher, Skövde, born April 8th, 1900 in Sandhem, Skaraborg County, first child of estate owner Albin B. and Jenny Andersson. Married in 1931 to Greta Gustafsson, and they had two children: Rigmor (born 1932) and Gilbert (born 1941). He graduated from high school in Skara in 1922, completed his Bachelor of Arts degree in Uppsala in 1925, his Master of Arts degree in 1927, his Bachelor of Theology degree in 1931, and was a pro tempore teacher in Uppsala in 1936. He taught in Falköping in 1928, Mariestad in 1929, was a substitute teacher in Borås from 1931-1932, extra teacher in Höganäs from 1932-1935, substitute teacher in Borås in 1936, extra and regular teacher in Uppsala from 1937-1938, teacher in Christian doctrine and Swedish language at Lysekil Junior High from 1937, and at Skövde Senior High School from 1946. He served as a librarian at Lysekil Junior High School from 1938-1946 and was a substitute principal from 1938-1945. He was a member of the school board for Lysekil Junior High from 1942-1946, served on the board for the Lysekil Right Association from 1943-1946, and was on the board for the Swedish Family Welfare and the Lysekil Tourist Association. He traveled to Denmark in 1933 and 1934 and to Norway in 1939. He wrote articles and reviews for newspapers and journals.

article.headline: Teacher's Role in Shaping Young Minds
